resources.string: "Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."
SECTION E: REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH (Complete this table for all married women aged 15-49 years in the household)
SECTION M: SOCIOL ECONOMIC STATUS OF HOUSEHOLD

Supporting Women and Girls in Pakistan Scaling Up
 Empowerment and Care Strategies to Address Health and Survival
 Centre of Excellence Women & Child Health
 Aga Khan University, Karachi, Pakistan

This information will be based on the list of villages generated from the district. Each enumerator will be given a list of clusters that he/she will be visiting, and before starting the interview, this information will be entered from the same list.
A103:\t Form Serial Number : Auto generated
Selected Head name present (A/C Line listing)
Please give me the names of the persons who usually live in your household, starting with the head of the household.
D103:\t Relationship to Head of HH
What is the relationship of [NAME] to the Head of the household ?
D106:\t Serial no of Father If father’s relation is “Not Available” in the members list then record code “NA”
D107:\t Serial no. of Mother If mother’s relation is “Not Available” in the members list then record code “NA”
D108:\t Date of Birth - If date of birth is not available record “00” and record age
If date of birth recorded then age will be automatically calculated from D.O.I and D.O.B
D110:\t Education What is the highest class (NAME) completed
For children less than five years, this variable will not be visible, and an auto generated NA code will appear.
D112:\t Total members of household (Auto calculated)
D113:\t Total married women of Reproductive age in household (Auto calculated)
D114:\t Total children of under 5 years age in household (Auto calculated)
D115:\t Is this Person are available at home ?
a102:/t Time of interview: In 24 hours format

a113_title1:/t The enumerator will read out the consent for understanding of respondent and will mention the purpose of the study and time required to complete the interviews (a separate consent sheet will be provided to the enumerators
a113_title3:/t IF VERBAL CONSENT IS NOT GIVEN STOP INTERVIEW AND MOVE TO QUESTION# A119 OF THIS SECTION TO RECORD THE OUTCOME OF THE INTERVIEW
a115:/t Age of Respondent in completed
a116:/t Does your HH Have a child aged 5-10-year?
a117:/t Does any child 5-10 year of aged group of This HH is suffering from any chronic disease?
a118:/t Is any child in your household aged 5 to 10 involved in any other nutritional research / project?
a119:/t Result of Household Questionnaire interview: Discuss any result not completed with team leader.
a119b:/t No household member at home or no competent respondent at home at time of visit
a119c:/t Entire household absent for extended period of time
a119e:/t Dwelling vacant or address not a dwelling
a119h:/t HH Having a child of 5-10-year age group with Chronic Desease
a119i:/t HH having a child of 5-10-year age group which is part of any nutrition study
a202:/t First, please tell me the name of each person who usually lives here, starting with the head of the household. Probe for additional household members.
a203:/t relationship with Head of household)?
a203d:/t Son in law/Daughter in law
a203i:/t Brother in law/Sister in law،

a206:/t How old is (name)?Record in completed years.98 DON’T KNOW

a302:/t What is your family’s religion?

a304:/t Main material of the roof RECORD OBSERVATION
a305:/t Main material of the walls RECORD OBSERVATION

a306:/t What is the main source of drinking water for members of your household?
a306aa:/t What is the main source of drinking water for members of your household? Municipal Community Water Connection
a307:/t What is the main source of drinking water for members of your household?
a307aa:/t What is the main source of water used by your household for other purposes such as cooking and hand washing? Municipal Community Water Connection
a308:/t Where is that water source located?
a308b:/t In own yard / plot out of dwelling
a309:/t How long does it take to get to the water source to get water and come back? Number of minutes
a310:/t Who usually goes to this source to collect water for the household? Is this person under age 15? What sex?
a311:/t How does that water in the household taste?

a313:/t Do you do anything to the water to make it safer to drink?
a314:/t What do you usually do to make the water safer to drink?
a314f:/t Let it stand and settle
a315:/t How many rooms in this house are used for sleeping? Number of rooms
a316:/t Do you own or rent the house that you live in?
a317:/t Is the cooking usually done in the house, in a separate building, or outdoors?
a317a:/t Separate room used as a kitchen
a318:/t What type of fuel does your household Mainly use for cooking?
a318k:/t No food cooked in household
a319:/t Does your household have? Multiple Response
a320:/t Do you have your own mobile phone sepretelly?
a321:/t Does any member of this household own? Multiple Response
a321f:/t Car or truck or bus
a322:/t What kind of toilet facility do members of your household usually use? Note for DC: (If not possible to determine, ask permission to observe the facility)
a322a_title:/t Flush or Pour Flush Toilet
a322a:/t Flush to piped sewer system
a322c:/t Flush to soakage pit latrine
a322e:/t Flush to unknown place/Not sure/DK where
a322h:/t PIT latrine without slab/open pit
a323:/t Do you share this facility with others who are not members of your household?
a324:/t Do you share this facility only with members of other households that you know, or is the facility open to the use of the general public?
a325:/t How many households in total use this toilet facility, including your own household?
a326:/t Does any member of this household own any agricultural land?

a327b:/t How many acres or kanals of agricultural land do members of this household own? Kanals

a401:/t Please show us where you and members of your household most often wash their hands.
a402:/t Observe presence of water at the specific place for hand washing.

b101:/t You or others in your household worried about not having enough food to eat because of a lack of money or other resources?
b102:/t How often did this happen?
b102a:/t Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
b102b:/t Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
b102c:/t Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b103:/t Still thinking about the last 12 months, was there a time when you or others in your household were unable to eat healthy and nutritious food because of lack of money or other resources?
b104:/t How often did this happen?
b104a:/t Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
b104b:/t Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
b104c:/t Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b105:/t Was there a time when you or others in your household ate only a few kinds of foods because of lack of money or other resources?
b106:/t How often did this happen?
b106a:/t Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
b106b:/t Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
b106c:/t Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b107:/t In the past 12 months, did you or any household member have to eat some foods that you really did not want to eat because of a lack of resources to obtain other types of food?
b108:/t How often did this happen?
b108a:/t Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
b108b:/t Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
b108c:/t Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b109:/t Was there a time when you or others in your household had to skip a meal because there was not enough money or other resources to get food?
b110:/t How often did this happen?
b110a:/t Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
b110b:/t Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
b110c:/t Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b111:/t Still thinking about the last 12 months, was there a time when you or others in your household ate less than you thought you should because of a lack of money or other resources?
b112:/t How often did this happen?
b112a:/t Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
b112b:/t Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
b112c:/t Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b113:/t Was there a time when your household ran out of food because of a lack of money or other resources?
b114:/t How often did this happen?
b114a:/t Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
b114b:/t Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
b114c:/t Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b115:/t Was there a time when you or others in your household were hungry but did not eat because there was not enough money or other resources?
b116:/t How often did this happen?
b116a:/t Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
b116b:/t Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
b116c:/t Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b117:/t Was there a time when you or others in your household went without eating for a whole day because of a lack of money or other resources?
b118:/t How often did this happen?
b118a:/t Rarely (once or twice in the past four weeks)
b118b:/t Sometimes (three to ten times in the past four weeks)
b118c:/t Often (more than ten times in the past four weeks)
b201:/t Yesterday, how many meals were eaten by adults?
b202:/t How does this compare to usual for the adults?
b203:/t Yesterday, how many meals were eaten by children
b204:/t How does this compare to usual for the children?

b301:/t Foods made from grains (bread, wheat, rice, maize, etc)
b302:/t White roots and tubers and plantains (potato, sweet potato, etc)
b303:/t Legumes, Nuts and Seeds (beans, peas, lentils)

c102_title_section:/t I’m going to begin by asking some questions about your child’s general health
c102_title:/t In the last 6 months, how often has (child name) had the following?

d901:/t Child (5-10 years) Name (Dropdown from HH member

d901_suba:/t 24-Hour Recall (on tablet) The recall should follow a standardized 24-hour recall multiple-pass format. The multiple-pass technique aims to reduce cognitive burden and improve reporting accuracy by encouraging respondents to report the foods that they consumed in stages, with increasing detail and opportunity to review and probe for potentially forgotten or misreported items. 1. Please list all the food consumed yesterday 2. Probe for foods that may have been missed (i.e. carbonated beverages, sweets, savory snacks, fruits, vegetables, breads). As well, probe to ask about additions to the food (i.e. salt, sugar, condiments etc.) 3. Collect time and name of eating occasion for each food 4. Using the measurement toolkit, collect detailed description and portion sizes of each food item. 5. Final review of all foods in chronological order, with portion size.
